squidpony.squidgrid.gui.awt

Class TextCellFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • squidpony.squidgrid.gui.awt.TextCellFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class TextCellFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Class for creating text blocks. The default characters guaranteed to fit are ASCII 33 through 125, which are the commonly used symbols, numbers, and letters.
    Author:
    Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TextCellFactory()
      Sets up this factory to ensure ASCII (or UTF-8) characters in the range 33 to 125 all fit and no padding on the cells.

      Returns the image of the character provided with a transparent background.

      Returns the image for the given character.

      Returns a string representation of the character and the hex value of the foreground.
      java.lang.String getStringRepresentationOf(char c, java.awt.Color foreground, java.awt.Color background)
      Returns a string representation of the character and the hex value of the foreground and background argb values.

      Sets up the factory to provide images based on the font's size.

      Sets the array of characters that will be checked to ensure they all fit in the text block.

      Sets the minimum amount of space between the characters and all four edges.
      void setPadding(int left, int right, int top, int bottom)
      Sets the minimum amount of space between the characters and the edges.

      Returns true if the given character will fit inside the current cell dimensions with the current font.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextCellFactory

        public TextCellFactory()
        Sets up this factory to ensure ASCII (or UTF-8) characters in the range 33 to 125 all fit and no padding on the cells. After this object is created one of the initialization methods must be called before it can be used.

    • Method Detail

      • getCellDimension

        public java.awt.Dimension getCellDimension()
        Returns the dimension of a single grid cell.
        Returns:

      • getFont

        public java.awt.Font getFont()
        Returns the font used by this factory.
        Returns:

      • emptyCache

        public void emptyCache()
        Clears out the backing cache. Should be used if a very large number of one-off cells are being made.

      • setAntialias

        public void setAntialias(boolean set)
        Sets whether or not characters should be drawn with antialiasing.
        Parameters:
        set -

      • setFitCharacters

        public void setFitCharacters(char[] fit)
        Sets the array of characters that will be checked to ensure they all fit in the text block. One of the provided initialization methods must be called to then make this take effect.
        Parameters:
        fit -

      • setPadding

        public void setPadding(int pad)
        Sets the minimum amount of space between the characters and all four edges.

      • initializeBySize

        public void initializeBySize(int cellWidth,
                    int cellHeight,
                    java.awt.Font font)
        Sets up the factory to provide images based on the cell cellWidth and cellHeight passed in. The font size will be used as a starting point, and reduced as needed to fit within the cell.
        Parameters:
        cellWidth -
        cellHeight -
        font -
        whiteSpace -

      • willFit

        public boolean willFit(char c)
        Returns true if the given character will fit inside the current cell dimensions with the current font. ISO Control characters are considered to fit by definition.
        Parameters:
        c -
        Returns:
